physical_examinations.vital_signs: WBC count 3.7 x 10^9/L, Neutrophil count 1.9 x 10^9/L
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Decrease in WBC and neutrophil counts without changes in other leukocytes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: WBC count decreased from baseline of 4.2 x 10^9/L.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: WBC count 2.5 x 10^9/L, Neutrophil count 1.3 x 10^9/L
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Significant decrease in WBC and neutrophil counts.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: WBC count 1.9 x 10^9/L, Neutrophil count 1.0 x 10^9/L, Lymphocyte count 0.6 x 10^9/L, Monocyte count 0.3 x 10^9/L, Eosinophil count 0.0 x 10^9/L, Basophil count 0.03 x 10^9/L
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe leukopenia with lactating symptoms of laryngitis and high fever (40.2 Â°C).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient developed fever and was admitted to the hospital, indicating acute deterioration.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recovery of WBC count after discontinuation of clozapine.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: WBC count increased from 1.9 x 10^9/L in April 2009 to 5.9 x 10^9/L.
